This review is for coco ramen that was eaten at the sushi bar next door. The two seem to share a space so if you don't want to wait in line for ramen, just get seated in the sushi bar and order yourself an uni nigiri appetizer. You can thank me later. 

Broth was average, egg was better than average. Noodle chewiness was well executed. Solid offering if you live in the neighborhood, but we are still searching for a place we can recommend enthusiastically like Totto in Manhattan.
author: Aman H.

description:
My friend and I walked into this place and one of the waiters just looked at us and continued on with what he was doing; no acknowledgement, no word, nothing. So we just stood around, waiting for a table to open up and for someone to come by to take us to a table.

We were given our menus and I ordered the curry ramen with medium spiciness and my friend ordered the shio ramen. The over all meal was okay and passable, there was nothing particularly worthy to note but nothing wrong either. However, that being said, how no one bothered to address us when we walked in the door is in very poor service, no "hello", no wait time approximation, just absolutely nothing made it feel like that they didn't want to serve us. So for multiple reasons, I will be hesitant to come back as they didn't give me a reason to.
author: Richard C.

description: The Tonkotsu ramen broth does not have the porky goodness. My husband ordered his Tonkotsu ramen mild, but it still came out  spicy.
author: TopCat W.

description: I was incredibly happy with this place!  Not only is it named COCO (my nickname, duh.) but the ramen was great!  The pork belly was incredible tender and the broth was delish (tonkatsu).  And as everyone suggests, get the Kobacha!  It's so awesome I was day dreaming about it the next day (and my dinner partner actually got another one to go the following day).  I'm afraid this place will get too popular and get busy!! Nooooo!
author: Nicole G.

description: This place does not use MSG. So awesome! The Tonkotsu ramen broth was delicious. My husband got his spicy. I got medium add black garlic and our kid got Unspicy. (Nxt time he will get minimal spicy not Unspicy). Spice level is just how much chili paste they put in. This place is in our neighborhood and is much better than most other restaurants around here. We loved it.
author: Precita M.

description: Wow, this place is really good. Thick pork belly slices, plenty of super tasty broth and lots of noodles. I got my tonkatsu ramen with black garlic. Winner here. Top ramen place in SF.
author: Gwen K.

description:
When I arrived the restaurant was packed and the waiting list was the same. I watched as all the staff hustled and turned over tables like magic. In no time we were seated and ordering appetizers & drinks.

Minus 1 star because the Agadashi Tofu was a miss. Also, we ordered a small bottle of Nama Sake off the shelf, but no prices were listed in the menu. Huge mistake not to ask before as the tiny bottle ending up being $25. I can usually buy a bottle of Nama Sake for about $10-$12 dollars so I was a little shocked to see that price on the check.

All in all the ramen was amazing. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen with pork belly and I was so happy with my choice! The pork belly was so tender and delicious and all the ingredients were super fresh! Will definitely be back to try their other ramen options.
author: Lizette C.

description: Been looking for a while for a restaurant with GREAT DATE LIGHTING i.e. lighting that flatters and Coco Ramen has it! Good food too! We ordered a Veggie Ramen, Miso Ramen, Gyoza appetizer, side of Kimchi and a small hot Sake & everything came out to under $33 (pre-tip). Service was attentive and warm like the nice lighting :) Noodles were deliciously chewy with savory, rich broth. I had a stomach ache from eating some bad pizza earlier in the day, and I swear the Miso ramen calmed my stomach so much I was able to sleep great that night. The only thing making this not a 5 star rating was that one of our eggs had some shell still attached which I had to very unflatteringly extract from my mouth into my napkin.. no biggie and I will definitely be back to sample the fried chicken app and Shoyu ramen.
author: Molasses C.

description: 4 of us walked in super hungry with high expectations and all walked out filled, impressed and determined to return.  The staff was great, the food was prompt and the flavors were so satisfying and rich!
author: Susan A.

description: Grilled squid did not deliver. It seemed steamed rather than fresh off the grill. Yakitori was decent. Got the spicy black garlic shoyu ramen. It was very flavorfull and actually spicy. Broth and noodles were piping hot which is how I like it. Overall decent ramen joint if you don't mind venturing out.
author: Phuong P.

description: It's not bad, honestly. It's hard to explain what's wrong about their ramen, but you can find out for yourself. The broth is obviously diluted with lots of water, and the meat is too salty. The service was average, but otherwise I had a good time. Although this place is pretty average, I wouldn't recommend it, or the place next door.
author: Christopher X.

description: Love this place! Had the tonkatsu ramen it wad great and executed wonderfully! The lovely older couple very attentive and nice, if it get s to packed they will definitely need another waitress asap
author: Juan A.

description: Super good ramen.  Had the vegan ramen and was surprised at the flavorful broth.  The kabocha was tasty too (pumpkin with soft boiled egg inside, lightly fried).
author: Lily B.

description: this place was kool my first time have noodles like this. but the curry noodle bowl I had tasted good would recommend going here.
author: Jay Y.

description:
I guess some reviewers mentioned about the chaotic task management at the restaurant, but I didn't read through the long reviews to notice the warning.

The Ramen in general is good, nothing special, but taste good. The server mixed up my Ramen and my friend's. We both ordered Miso Ramen, but I ordered it without garlic and spice, but extra veggies. He handed me over my friend's Ramen and said it is the one with extra veggies, so I didn't question further even though I was suspicious. It looks a bit red (indicates chili source), and I can't really tell there is extra veggies. But the thing is the one my friend got doesn't seem to have extra veggies either.... we accepted them as is, but I was not quite happy about the fact of mixing up and the lack of veggies. We ordered hot tea, it took quite a while for them to serve, and the tea came out cold. They gave us new ones when we mentioned it, so that's good. My friend ordered a bottle of sake, but the server seemed a bit pushy to get us out when my friend was still enjoying his sake. I understand there is a line waiting, but rushing your customers is never a good thing.

I actually have one suggestion for this place: open up your seats at Crazy Sushi since it's the same place, same owner. Why having your customers wait when the other side is empty? You are not maximizing your potential revenue!
author: Jenny N.

description: Really good ramen, spicy, creamy and filling. The ambience is something to be desired, while we were there some jazz clarinet music was skipping and the dining furniture looks like something from an elderly person's estate sale. Will go back.
author: Lauren M.

description: I judge ramen largely by the broth. This restaurant's broth had a unique flavor that my friend absolutely loved, but it wasn't for me. I wanted more of a rich pork taste to it. The noodles were good and firm amd the toppings were good. Service was quick on a weekday afternoon.
author: Apple P.

description: This is my kids favorite place to get Ramen. They urged me to write my first Yelp review to give a five-star rating.
author: Janice A.

description:
I had a very bad experience at this restaurant yesterday. I was a regular customer there and we had a family tradition of going there on weekend evening. We would always enjoy our experience of going to a friendly neighborhood ramen place. I had always gone there with my husband and 2 year old daughter previously, but last evening around 7:00 pm I went there with my daughter. This restaurant has two connected sections with seating in both sections. When I got there one of the sections was completely full except for two bar-style tables along the front windows. The waitress who approached to seat me asked if I'd like to be seated at the window seat with high bar chairs. Since I was with my toddler daughter, I did not feel it was safe for her to be seated on a high bar seat so I said no and that I would prefer to be seated at a normal table. The waitress replied to that and said that in that case I would have to wait. There were several empty tables in the adjoining seating area that I could see and I asked her the waitress about being seated there. To that she replied "those tables are for sushi, you will have to wait". So without even asking me whether I wanted to order sushi or not, she automatically presumed that I don't want sushi! I guess I must have had "I don't want sushi written all over my forehead!"

After a few seconds contrary to her earlier statement, the waitress came back and led me to table in the "Sushi" section, which was possibly the most horrible and uncomfortable table in that section or the entire place. It was a really low table by the window, with very small and low and uncomfortable stools to sit on, even though there were several normal tables available in that section. My toddler daughter kept falling off the tiny stool all the time. I saw several people in that section eating normal food including ramen and not just sushi and when I questioned one of the waiters about it and that why I was told that this was the "sushi" only section when there were several people eating other food as well, he said that people in that section had to order sushi besides ordering normal food and that since I had a small child with me they had made an "exception" for me and given me a table in that section.

After that I ordered 2 appetizers and a ramen bowl for main course. The order in which my food arrived was: 1 appetizer and the ramen and 15 minutes later the second appetizer. The waiter who took my order, specifically asked me if I wanted an extra bowl for my daughter for the ramen and I had said yes to that, but the extra bowl never arrived and when I tried to flag one of the waiters to try to get one, they deliberately avoided making eye contact to avoid me.

Coco Ramen, you just lost a loyal customer! I am never going back to your restaurant and neither will I ever recommend it to anyone I know. I hope you learn to treat your customers equally, fairly, and with dignity and respect in the future.
author: Shalini D.

description: Excellent new ramen spot! Service is great, no wait and food was good. The tonkatsu black garlic ramen is tasty and filling. The grilled whole garlic is good too if your a garlic lover like myself! We also ordered the agedashi tofu which was fried perfectly with good sauce.
author: Kristin M.

description: So good! The ramen here is amazing, especially the tonkotsu. I always ask for extra veggies and get tons. I thought the service was great and attentive, the woman at the front was very friendly and helpful. Plus they offer takeout which lots of ramen places don't do.
author: Alix R.

description: The quality of the ramen is above average. However service is typically very slow, and I think it's pricey for what you get.
author: Eugene H.

description:
Veggie ramen was wonderfully flavorful and scary-red with chili spice (at my request). Noodles were chewy.  Slow-cooked egg was a great addition.

Biggest complaint: shishito yakitori was a disappointment. I'm so used to shishitos being pan-seared and coming in a big bowl sprinkled with sea salt that I didn't even think about what it meant for them to be done as yakitori: 3 big-ish peppers, one per skewer, for $3.  No salt or other flavoring. Not tasty and not a good value.

That said I would totally, absolutely go back for the ramen.
author: Rajiv B.

description: Delicious but not good for little kids. :( It's like a library in there. The hipsters want their quiet!
author: Chris V.

description: I got the shio broth ramen extra spicy with the fried garlic and extra noodles. I started with the karaage, which the guy (the proprietor, I presume) kept pronouncing "car age" haha. I don't care that this place isn't "authentic". My issue with this place is that everything I ordered was too salty. The roast pork in the ramen was pretty good. Also, they had Asahi Black, which I hadn't had in ages. Friendly service.
author: Maximillian M.

description: MSG-laden ramen that was pretty unforgettable. We all got headaches -- there are better places in town for ramen.
author: Missy S.

description: I had delicious Tonkotsu ramen at Coco's last night. The pork belly was perfect and I opted to add garlic and a medium spice level. The broth was super rich and creamy. I was very satisfied with my meal. However, my friend who got the vegetarian ramen was not impressed. He said it was flavorless. The ramen was a little expensive, about$12/bowl.
author: Kristen F.

description: Would recommend to anyone. The ambiance was really nice. A little dark but that doesn't matter. The grilled squid was perfect! You know it's cooked right when it's chewy but not too hard to chew apart. There were plenty of ramen choices. I tried the Tonkatsu and Seafood. Both tasted great and proportion wise had a lot more than some other restaurants. Waiter and waitress really nice. (FYI, Sitting at the bar gets you faster service). Again, recommend anyone to check it out.
author: Sheldon H.

description: Trying out a new ramen place in my neighborhood, Bernal heights.  This place was very good.  The spicy ramen was perfect not overly spicy but enough to feel it and they use black garlic which adds a lot of flavor.  Highly recommend this place
author: David Q.

description: I don't review often, but Coco merits it partly because it's a bit more of a neighborhood joint and probably won't attract a lot of buzz.  Their ramen was solid, better than most of the ramen in Japantown, maybe even Suzu.  It's probably now going to stand toe-to-toe against Ken Ken or even Nute's Noodles, but that's going to be their competition from my stand point.  I didn't have their tonkotsu which is a real comparison point, but their miso was good and their veggie broth version was very good.  And they have solid ajitama eggs.  Not all places have these shoyu marinated slow cooked eggs and theirs was excellent, as good as Ken Ken's.  They put a lot of love into the presentation and included toppings.  Good (non-funky) bamboo shoot is refreshing too.  Highly recommend if you live in the neighborhood.
author: Christian G.

description: So delicious. We had the tonkotsu and curry ramen. It's attached to the sushi restaurant
author: Woody P.

description:
I'm not an expert (or particularly knowledgeable at all) about ramen but I thought the two types that I tried were quite good. The portions were generous and the prices were good. Service was also very friendly.

They had some fun Japanese sodas with the balls on top that tasted pretty good. 

I'd go back again and my wife felt the same way. I think that this is owned by the sushi place next door as there is an internal way to go to either restaurant once you are inside either. 

A nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: Ben L.

description: Came here for their ramen with my BFF on Friday. We were the first customers that day but within 15 mins the seats were all taken up. We ordered spicy Tonkatsu and shiro ramen and their house special fried wings. The wings were really good. As for the ramen, the noodles were perfectly cooked, the egg still have the soft yolk and the pork belly just melt in your mouth. There were so good. Oh and the broth were really good. I am glad there is no MSG in it and that's a plus point. Will definitely come again. The only down side is quite difficult to find a parking here.
author: Soo W.

description: Good ramen! It's one to put on your list. I had the rich ramen with porkbelly and it was great. Love ramen and I really like this place.
author: James D.

description:
The service was super friendly, got a little slow, but that was due to our large party, amount of food we got, and they got really busy very fast for such a small area.

The appetizers were by far the best thing that we had, and i believe that we had one of everything on the menu. best apps in my opinion was the Salmon Kama, and the pumpkin wrapped fried egg (kabocha)! that was outstanding. 

all the ramens that our party had were good. had every single one on the menu, but by far the two favorites were the tonkostu and the Miso.
The Tonkotsu was decently flavored and had a good pork essence, but I am a big fan of a more thick dense broth, that is why i felt the Miso was a tad better. It was more thick and Creamy, as it states on the menu. oh and the pork belly, OUTSTANDING! highly recomend adding this in or adding extra, worth it!
author: Tyler F.

description: Went there on Friday for the first time. Fantastic. The ramen bowl was tasty, fresh, and complex. I had the traditional with the BBQ pork. Looking forward to trying all of the others!
author: Seth B.

description: I love the tonkotsu with pork belly, garlic and I order it spicy for a little kick. Take out is usually pretty fast. Great spot!
author: Lisa W.

description: Broth is super weird. I recommend considering a different option. It's as if the broth is primarily flavored with a vinegary hot sauce. Wins award for most bizarre ramen I've ever had.
author: Saskia R.

description: The miso ramen is delicious. They charge if you sub tofu for the meat (lame) but I'm stoked to have found this spot. Close enough to mission to walk to it and definitely filling a ramen void in the hood. I haven't tried anything else on the menu yet and probably won't because this just hits the spot. Jump in spice from mild to medium but I found medium to be a good challenge. They package it well to go, everything separately. The noodles are cooked perfect and the broth is rich and flavorful. Highly recommend it!
author: Ashley M.

description: Ramen is delicious and flavoring is very consistent. My personal favorite is the tonkotsu ramen, mild, regular garlic, with pork belly and extra cabbage. Yummers!
author: Mary H.

description: Best ramen in town! I am ramen enthusiast from middle west. Tried 5 ramen shop in bay area in this trip I took last week. Coco's is my favorite! noodle is more chewy, soup is not as salty as others, and the pork! it is just taste so different. I love this shop.
author: archer c.
